questions.questionLabel: What is a component in Angular?
Explain the purpose of the NgModule in Angular.
What is data binding in Angular?
What is a directive in Angular?
What is dependency injection in Angular?
What is a closure in JavaScript?
Explain the difference between var, let, and const.
What is an arrow function in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of promises in JavaScript?
Explain the concept of hoisting in JavaScript.
What does HTML stand for?
What is the purpose of the <head> tag in HTML?
What is the difference between <div> and <span>?
What are semantic HTML elements?
What is the purpose of the alt attribute in images?
What is the difference between padding and margin in CSS?
What are CSS selectors?
Explain the concept of the box model in CSS.
What is flexbox in CSS?
What is the difference between inline, block, and inline-block elements?

answers.answerLabel: A reusable building block for the user interface
A style in Angular
NgModule is used to declare and configure modules in Angular applications.
NgModule is a directive.
Data binding is a mechanism to synchronize data between component and view.
Data binding is used for styling components.
A directive is a marker on a DOM element that tells Angular to do something with it.
A directive is a module.
Dependency injection provides components with the services or objects they need.
Dependency injection adds styles to components.
A closure gives access to an outer function’s scope from an inner function.
A closure is a type of loop.
var is function-scoped, let and const are block-scoped.
They are all exactly the same.
Arrow functions are a shorter syntax for writing functions.
Arrow functions are loops.
Promises are used to handle asynchronous operations.
Promises are for synchronous operations.
Hoisting is JavaScript’s default behavior of moving declarations to the top.
Hoisting is related to CSS layout.
HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.
HyperText Management Language.
The <head> tag contains metadata and links to resources.
The <head> tag displays page content.
<div> is block-level; <span> is inline.
Both are identical.
Semantic elements clearly describe their meaning (e.g., <header>, <footer>).
Semantic elements have no effect.
The alt attribute provides alternative text for images.
The alt attribute sets image borders.
Padding is inside the element; margin is outside.
They are the same.
CSS selectors define which elements styles apply to.
CSS selectors are HTML attributes.
The box model defines how padding, border, and margin affect element layout.
The box model is used for animations.
Flexbox is a layout model that arranges elements efficiently in a container.
Flexbox is a color model.
Inline elements do not start a new line; block elements do; inline-block combines both behaviors.
All three behave identically.
